Posts.Content: twistedsteel wrote: I had neo (12 taxol and 4 DD AC), then MX, then rads. Now I am supposed to start The Big X. I have read all the SE possibilities. I have white cotton gloves, cera vie cream and a petroleum based cream. I have compazine, imodium on hand and zofran refill available. I am going out of town for a daughter's horse show this coming weekend. I am debating whether to take the Xeloda starting today when I get it or wait 7 more days. Until after the show. I have not had chemo since the end of September. Would waiting a week be stupid? Lord knows, i don't want to give any random floaters a chance to settle in as mets. What would you do? Be nervous and uncomfortable out of town or wait until in the comfort of home to start? End breast cancer by 2020. Breastcancerdeadline2020.org Dx 4/25/2011, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IIIA, Grade 2, 3/12 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Hints for stage 3 sister about to start xeloda twistedsteel twistedsteel
